prompt: <description>**Part 1** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For the sketch, create a face (face\\_1) and on this face, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of a single circle (circle\\_1). The circle should have a center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.375. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.2083 and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. This operation will create a new solid body. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.75, 0.75, and 0.2083 respectively. **Part 2** Construct a similar cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, with reflective and shiny appearance. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.1167, 0.1167, 0.2083. For the sketch, create a face (face\\_1) and on this face, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of a single circle (circle\\_1). The circle should have a center at (0.2583, 0.2583) and a radius of 0.2583. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5167. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.2917 and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. This operation will join the new solid body with the previous one. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.5167, 0.5167, and 0.2917 respectively.</description>

Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a series of lines to form a shape with the following vertices: * [0.0, 0.0] * [0.7, 0.0] * [0.7, 0.75] * [0.475, 0.75] * [0.475, 0.125] * [0.225, 0.125] * [0.225, 0.75] * [0.0, 0.75] * [0.0, 0.0] This will result in a rectangle with a curved side. Close the loop by connecting the last point to the first point. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it using the euler angles defined in the coordinate system and translating it using the translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.375 units, creating a solid object. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.125, 0.0, 0.4375]. Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with a center at [0.0625, 0.0625] and a radius of 0.0625. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 1.5 units, creating a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Part 3: Construct two diagonal cylindrical objects Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and a translation vector of [0.0919, 0.6391, 0.0]. Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw two circles with the following centers and radii: * Center: [0.0331, 0.0331], Radius: 0.0331 * Center: [0.0331, 0.5451], Radius: 0.0331 Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.25 units, creating two diagonal cylindrical objects. The resulting assembly will be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has dimensions of 3 units by 2 units by 1 unit, and the hole has a diameter of 0.5 units.</description>
